text: is there any way to get a WYSIWYG editor for one of these static site generators?

elements.text: is there any way to get a WYSIWYG editor for one of these static site generators?

text: yeah, lol. I know its weird, but I want to own my website code too. I guess what I am asking is an easier way to write posts on a static generated blog.

elements.text: yeah, lol. I know its weird, but I want to own my website code too. I guess what I am asking is an easier way to write posts on a static generated blog.

text: or maybe I am over engineering it, squarespace doesn't like put ads on free tier, right?

elements.text: or maybe I am over engineering it, squarespace doesn't like put ads on free tier, right?

text: <@U010LT79LKX> - maybe try Franklin.jl and deploy that to GitHub pages. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: - maybe try Franklin.jl and deploy that to GitHub pages.

text: You can also make edits to the document and see immediately see changes on your own local browser. So its kinda like WYSIWYG with the immediate visual feedback but not really since no GUI for other features you might want. Just in case you weren't aware of it. I've done this with Franklin.jl, and Hugo
